subject: Climate & Environment
title: Bioplastics: Promise or Problem
description: A short lesson to help you apply Bioplastics: Promise or Problem.

hook.text: Bioplastics are made from plants instead of petroleum. They sound perfect â€” but they're complicated.

buildup.text: PLA plastic comes from corn starch. It looks and feels like regular plastic.

discovery.text: Most bioplastics only break down in industrial composters at high temperatures.

twist.text: In a landfill or ocean, bioplastics persist almost as long as conventional plastic.

climax.text: Without proper composting infrastructure, bioplastics can cause more confusion than benefit.

punchline.text: A better material means nothing without a better system to handle it.

quiz.question: Why don't most bioplastics solve the plastic waste problem?
options: They only decompose in industrial composters, not in nature
They are more toxic than regular plastic
They cost too much to produce
